message:
The IDF spokesperson published documentation of the aerial assassination of the four terrorists 👆 tonight in Nur Shams in Tulkarm:

IDF: Last night (Tuesday), during a joint IDF and ISA operational activity in Nur Shams, four terrorists were identified attempting to plant explosive devices in proximity to a site at which an explosive was detonated two days prior (Monday). The planting of the explosive devices was designed to attack IDF soldiers operating in the area. 

Following the identification, an IDF aircraft carried out a precise strike on the terrorist cell, eliminating four terror operatives who were a significant part of terrorist infrastructure in Nur Shams: Muhammad Shehade, Muhammad Kanouah, Yazid Shafa, and Namer Ibrahim.
event_breakdown:

The planting of the explosive devices was designed to attack IDF soldiers operating in the area. 
IDF: Following the identification, an IDF aircraft carried out a precise strike on the terrorist cell, eliminating four terror operatives who were a significant part of terrorist infrastructure in Nur Shams: Muhammad Shehade, Muhammad Kanouah, Yazid Shafa, and Namer Ibrahim.

message: Hajj Abu Nee'ma 👆 who was killed today in Tyre, together with Taleb Abdullah and Wissam al-Tawil (the latter two pictured here, who were killed in the last few months) are the three most senior members that Israel killed in Hezbollah since the beginning of the war.
event_breakdown:
* Hajj Abu Nee'ma, Taleb Abdullah, and Wissam al-Tawil, three senior members of Hezbollah, were killed in Tyre, Lebanon.
* Israeli airstrikes targeted a building in Beirut, Lebanon, causing damage but causing no casualties.
* Syrian government forces clashed with rebel fighters in the north-western province of Idlib, causing casualties and displacement.
* Two explosive devices detonated in Baghdad, Iraq, killing at least one person and wounding several others.
* Gunmen attacked a security checkpoint in the Somali capital Mogadishu, killing three police officers.
* Turkish forces and Syrian Kurdish militia exchanged fire in the north-east region of Syria, causing casualties and displacement.
* Iranian-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen fired a ballistic missile at a military parade in the southern city of Aden, killing at least six people including a senior military commander
* Israeli airstrikes targeted buildings in Syria, causing damage but no casualties.
* Jordanian Border guard officers neutralized two infiltrators, including an Iraqi young man who was wearing an explosive vest, close to the Syrian border.
* Al Shabaab insurgents attacked a village in the northern region of Kenya, killing two people and leaving others missing.

The Aziz unit, together with the Nasser unit, is responsible for the entire southern Lebanese sector of Hezbollah.

Less than a month ago, Taleb Abdullah 👆 commander of the Nasser unit in Hezbollah was killed.

message:
Lebanese channels: an Israeli aircraft attacked a vehicle in the Khush area of ​​the city of Tyre in southern Lebanon.

Hajj Abu Nee'ma was reportedly was killed in the attack. He is the commander of the Aziz unit in Hezbollah. His son was injured.

A very impressive elimination by the IDF.
Hezbollah will have to respond...
event_breakdown:
IDF air raid targets a Hezbollah leader's car in Lebanon's Khush area

The Israeli air force carried out an airstrike targeting a vehicle in the Khush area near the city of Tyre in southern Lebanon on Sunday, Lebanese media reported.

The target of the attack was Hajj Abu Nee'ma, the commander of the Aziz unit, within Hezbollah. He died, and his son was wounded.

Hezbollah has not commented on the attack.

message:
Gaza channels publish photos and videos of armored vehicles that "the IDF abandoned after the resistance hit them in Rafah and Shejaiya."

The excitement is heard in the voices of the Palestinians in the video due to the "achievements of the resistance"...

They just didn't notice that it was the same type of tools that they themselves claimed the IDF uses to blow up houses remotely without soldiers inside, like here👆👆
event_breakdown:

On May 20, Gaza channels published photos and videos of armored vehicles that the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) had allegedly abandoned after the "resistance" hit them in Rafah and Shejaiya, Gaza. The Palestinians expressed excitement over the achievements of the resistance. The armored vehicles were of a similar type that the Palestinians had previously claimed the IDF uses to blow up houses remotely without soldiers inside.

message:
Yesterday, the military wing of Hamas released a video taken in the Rafah area in which Hamas operatives are seen placing a bomb on an Israeli tank.
I usually do not publish enemy videos in which IDF soldiers are harmed.
In this case, I am publishing the video today, after "sources in the field" said that there were no casualties in the incident. Explains why Hamas chose not to show the seconds after the explosion...

Not everything that "photographs well" in Hamas videos necessarily indicates damage to the forces.

But it must be admitted that the scene in the video is not encouraging in the fact that the terrorists came so close to the tank, but as mentioned, there were no injured in the incident.
event_breakdown:
Event: Security researchers discovered vulnerabilities in Telestar Diginet routers built by Telnet
Date: June 13, 2022
Location: Telnet
Target event:
Security researchers have discovered vulnerabilities in Telnet's Telestar Diginet routers that could be abused by unauthenticated attackers to achieve remote code execution with the highest privileges.
The vulnerabilities were reported to the company in May 2020, but it only released firmware updates in April 2022. Analysis of Telestar Diginet router firmware versions 1.8.0, 1.8.1, and 1.8.2 revealed that the flaws affect the firmware's installation process.
"
The flaws can be used by attackers to inject malicious code during the update process in order to gain complete control over the router, update the configuration, and conduct distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks," Check Point researchers reported in a Monday analysis. "
Source
The attack shelf is codenamed Hxp0rs, relates to the vulnerability, and is likely to be used
to target routers with a high emphasis on obtaining code execution or the ability to carry out specific operations to help launch various attacks.
According to a timeline the attack shelf dates to between November 2019 and March 2021 after which it was used against six targets across four different countries. The timeline is incomplete but Check Point suggests the attackers are two separate threat groups which both targeted North Korea and Belarus. None of the denial-of-service attacks were launched against
eight targets

message:
"Peace Now" movement to the AP news agency:
Israel approved taking over 12.7 square kilometers of Jordan Valley land.
event_breakdown:
Israel has approved taking over 12.7 square kilometers (4.9 square miles) of Jordan Valley land, according to the "Peace Now" movement that revealed the development.

The Israeli government said that the seizure was approved recently but Peace Now, a left-wing rights group, shared the information on Friday night, reports the Associated Press news agency.

It is second such seizure announced by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's government in less than two months, according to Peace Now.

According to the AP report, Israel captured the West Bank and east Jerusalem in the 1967 Mideast war, and has ever since controlled more than 60% of that area. The Palestinians seek those lands for a future state. Most of the international community considers Israeli settlements illegal and obstacles to peace.

Israel has long been criticized for its settlement policies, including the one allowing settlers to move into Palestinian neighborhoods in occupied east Jerusalem and housing demolitions.

message:
IDF: The IDF struck and eliminated the commander of the Aziz Unit in the Hezbollah Terrorist Organization

Earlier today (Wednesday), the IDF eliminated the terrorist Muhammad Neamah Naser, the commander of the Hezbollah terrorist organization’s Aziz Unit which is responsible for firing from southwestern Lebanon at Israeli territory. 

Muhammad Neamah Naser entered his position in 2016 and led the firing of rockets and anti-tank missiles from southwestern Lebanon toward Israeli civilians, communities, and security forces. Furthermore, Naser directed a large number of terror attacks toward Israel both during and before the war, and he previously held several central roles within the Hezbollah terrorist organization.

Naser was the counterpart of Sami Taleb Abdullah, the commander of the Nasser Unit, who was eliminated last month. Together, they served as two of the most significant Hezbollah terrorists in southern Lebanon.
event_breakdown:
IDF strikes Hezbollah commander - Aziz Unit in the Hezbollah Terrorist Organization
The IDF eliminated the head of the Hezbollah troop that had fired rockets into Israel from Lebanon for several years.

message:
Are we close to the surrender of Hamas? What are the surrender criteria? What can be done to advance the surrender?

In recent days, there have been increasing reports in the media that the IDF is about to announce the end of the current phase of the fighting in the Gaza Strip and then move to the third phase which will be based on raids on field cells in the Gaza Strip.

As the preoccupation with the end of the current phase increases, the obvious question arises: has Hamas surrendered? Is Hamas nearing surrender? Shouldn't the surrender be certain after the ground operation in Rafah? What needs to happen for Hamas to be defeated? How do you measure surrender? Does the elimination of Sinwar or his capture mean the defeat of Hamas?

I will try to answer at least some of these questions.

First we will examine the numerical data:

1. Before the war, according to various estimates in Israel, the military force in the Gaza Strip was distributed as follows:
About 30 thousand operatives of the military wing of Hamas.
About 10,000 operatives of the military arm of the Islamic Jihad.
About 5,000-7,000 operatives of the military arms of the other Palestinian factions in the Strip.
About 20 thousand operatives of the security mechanisms of Hamas.

Total armed men in the Strip (including police forces) - between 60 and 70 thousand people.

2. According to the data of the Ministry of Health in Gaza, about 38 thousand Gazans have been killed so far.

3. Based on an analysis of Prime Minister Netanyahu's data from last March, it appears that over 42% of those killed in Gaza are terrorists (which is an excellent figure by any international military standard). If we use this ratio for the purpose of calculation, it turns out that 16,000 of the deaths declared by the Palestinian Ministry of Health in Gaza are terrorists.

4. According to a publication by Channel Kaan dated July 1, there are 1300 Gazan terrorists imprisoned in Israel.

5. Hamas claims that there are 10,000 missing persons and let's assume for this purpose that there is also a ratio of 42% terrorists out of the dead. That means about 4200 terrorists are buried under the ruins (including those who were killed in tunnels).

6. About a thousand terrorists were killed inside Israel on October 7th.

From the summary of the data, it can be estimated that about 22 thousand out of about 70 thousand Gazan who carry weapons have definitively left the circle of combat.

We are left with a little less than 50 thousand still alive.
We need to subtract from this those wounded who cannot return to combat, and others who fled abroad, but even if we are very generous regarding the number of wounded terrorists and those who fled and allow a wide margin for the margin of error in the estimates, we are still left with tens of thousands of trained terrorists carrying weapons that allow, as of this stage, The continuation of Hamas' rule and the thwarting of any other party that aspires to be a governing alternative to Hamas.

So how is it that the IDF did not kill more terrorists?

It is important to note that the terrorists embed themselves into the civilian population and dress in civilian clothes and it is difficult to fish them out one by one with airstrikes or ground raids. According to the daily rate of deaths indicated by the Ministry of Health in Gaza in the last two months, it will take a long time to exterminate all the terrorists.

Rafah is a good example of this. Let's dive in:

Rafah's Hamas brigade contains four battalions. In an average Hamas battalion in the Gaza Strip, there are about a thousand military operatives.
In the current maneuver in Rafah, which according to various publications is about to end soon, according to the Chief of Staff (as of July 2), about 900 terrorists were killed out of the operatives of the 4 battalions. There are still about 3000 military operatives who were not killed and most of them apparently fled north from Rafah.
location: The main focus of the event mentioned in the text appears to be the Gaza Strip.
